00001 /**
00002  * @file   litm.h
00003  *
00004  * @date   2009-04-24
00005  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  * @mainpage Welcome to the documentation for the library LITM
00008  *
00009  *           The library serves as a <b>Lightweight Inter-Thread Messaging</b> under Linux/Unix.
00010  *
00011  * \section Dependencies
00012  *
00013  *                      <b>Mandatory</b>
00014 
00015  *          - libpthread
00016  *
00017  *          <b>Optional</b>
00018  *          The following components are only required if building from source:
00019  *
00020  *          - scons
00021  *
00022  *          - python package "pyjld.os" (available through <i>easy_install</i>)
00023  *
00024  *
00025  */
00026 
00027 #ifndef LITM_H_
00028 #define LITM_H_
00029 
00030 #       include <sys/types.h>
00031 #       include <pthread.h>
00032 
00033 
00034 #       define LITM_CONNECTION_MAX 15
00035 #       define LITM_BUSSES_MAX     7
00036 
00037                 /**
00038                  * Queue node - entry in a queue
00039                  *
00040                  * @param msg:  pointer to the message
00041                  * @param next: pointer to the ``next`` queue_node entry
00042                  */
00043                 typedef struct _queue_node {
00044                         void *node;
00045                         struct _queue_node *next;
00046                 } queue_node;
00047 
00048                 /**
00049                  * Queue - thread-safe
00050                  *
00051                  * @param mutex: mutex
00052                  * @param head:  pointer to ``head``
00053                  * @param tail:  pointer to ``tail``
00054                  */
00055                 typedef struct {
00056                         pthread_mutex_t *mutex;
00057                         struct _queue_node *head, *tail;
00058                 } queue;
00059 
00060 
00061                 /**
00062                  * ``Bus`` identifier type
00063                  */
00064                 typedef int litm_bus;
00065 
00066                 /**
00067                  * ``Connection Status`` type
00068                  */
00069                 typedef enum _litm_connection_status_codes {
00070                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_INVALID = 0,
00071                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_ACTIVE,
00072                         LITM_CONNECTION_STATUS_PENDING_DELETION
00073                 } litm_connection_status;
00074 
00075                 /**
00076                  * ``Connection`` type
00077                  *
00078                  * @param input_queue the connection's input queue
00079                  */
00080                 typedef struct _litm_connection {
00081                         litm_connection_status status;
00082                         queue *input_queue;
00083                 } litm_connection;
00084 
00085                 //typedef _litm_connection litm_connection;
00086 
00087                 /**
00088                  * Envelope Routing
00089                  *
00090                  * @param pending Pending Status Flag
00091                  * @param bus_id  Destination ``bus``
00092                  * @param sender  The sender's connection pointer
00093                  * @param current The current recipient's connection pointer
00094                  */
00095                 typedef struct {
00096                         int                              pending;
00097                         litm_bus         bus_id;
00098                         litm_connection *sender;
00099                         litm_connection *current;
00100                 } __litm_routing;
00101 
00102 
00103 
00104 
00105                 // Return Codes
00106                 // ------------
00107                 //
00108                 typedef enum _litm_codes {
00109                         LITM_CODE_OK = 0,
00110                         LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE,
00111                         LITM_CODE_BUSY,
00112                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC,
00113                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_OPEN,
00114                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION,
00115                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_MORE_CONNECTIONS,
00116                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS,
00117                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT,
00118                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT,
00119                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND,
00120                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING,                                 //can't send to the recipient
00121                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE,
00122                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE,
00123                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND,
00124                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL,
00125                         LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS,
00126                         LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE
00127 
00128                 } litm_code;
00129 
00130 
00131                 /**
00132                  * ``Envelope`` structure for messages
00133                  *
00134                  * @param cleaner The ``cleaner`` function to use
00135                  * @param routes  The ``routing`` structure
00136                  * @param msg     The pointer to the message
00137                  *
00138                  * Contains the pointer to the message
00139                  *  as well as a ``routing`` structure
00140                  *  used to deliver the said message
00141                  *  to all bus which have at least
00142                  *  1 subscriber.
00143                  *
00144                  * The client (ie. receiver of the envelope)
00145                  *  must not tamper with the message (ie. msg)
00146                  *  as it is shared with other client(s).
00147                  *
00148                  */
00149                 typedef struct _litm_envelope {
00150 
00151                         int released_count;
00152                         int delivery_count;
00153                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg);
00154                         __litm_routing routes;
00155                         void *msg;
00156 
00157                 } litm_envelope;
00158 
00159 
00160                 /**
00161                  * Opens a ``connection`` to the ``switch``
00162                  *  and returns a pointer to the connection reference
00163                  *
00164                  * @param **conn pointer to connection reference
00165                  */
00166                 litm_code litm_connect(litm_connection **conn);
00167 
00168 
00169                 /**
00170                  * Disconnects from the ``switch``
00171                  *
00172                  * Once a client calls this function, no more access
00173                  * with the connection is permitted to any of the
00174                  * following functions:
00175                  *
00176                  *  - litm_subscribe
00177                  *  - litm_unsubscribe
00178                  *  - litm_receive_nb
00179                  *  - litm_send
00180                  *  - litm_release
00181                  *
00182                  * Be sure to release any message in the client's
00183                  * care before disconnecting.
00184                  *
00185                  * @param *conn connection reference
00186                  */
00187                 litm_code litm_disconnect(litm_connection *conn);
00188 
00189 
00190                 /**
00191                  * Subscribe to a ``bus``
00192                  *
00193                  * @see litm_disconnect
00194                  *
00195                  * @param *conn connection reference
00196                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to subscribe to
00197                  *
00198                  */
00199                 litm_code litm_subscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00200 
00201 
00202                 /**
00203                  * Unsubscribe from a ``bus``
00204                  *
00205                  * @see litm_disconnect
00206                  *
00207                  * @param *conn connection reference
00208                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` identifier to unsubscribe from
00209                  */
00210                 litm_code litm_unsubscribe(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id);
00211 
00212 
00213                 /**
00214                  * Send message on a ``bus``
00215                  *
00216                  * @see litm_disconnect
00217                  *
00218                  * @param *conn connection reference
00219                  * @param bus_id the ``bus`` to send the message onto
00220                  * @param *msg the pointer to the message
00221                  * @param *cleaner the pointer to the cleaner function
00222                  *
00223                  * If omitted, the default ``cleaner`` function will be
00224                  * <b>free()</b>.
00225                  *
00226                  * If an error occurs, it is the responsibility of the sender
00227                  *  to dispose of the ``messages`` appropriately.  If the
00228                  *  operation went LITM_CODE_OK, then once all recipients
00229                  *  are finished with the message, the ``cleaner`` will be
00230                  *  called with the message pointer OR if ``cleaner`` is
00231                  *  NULL, the message will simply be freed with free().
00232                  *
00233                  */
00234                 litm_code litm_send(    litm_connection *conn,
00235                                                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00236                                                                 void *msg,
00237                                                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg)
00238                                                                 );
00239 
00240 
00241                 /**
00242                  * Receives (non-blocking) from any ``bus``
00243                  *
00244                  * @see litm_disconnect
00245                  *
00246                  * @param *conn connection reference
00247                  * @param **envlp the pointer to received envelope
00248                  *
00249                  */
00250                 litm_code litm_receive_nb(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp);
00251 
00252 
00253                 /**
00254                  * Releases an ``envelope``
00255                  *
00256                  * @see litm_disconnect
00257                  *
00258                  * @param *conn connection reference
00259                  * @param *envlp the pointer to received envelope to release
00260                  *
00261                  *  Once the client has consumed the message
00262                  *  ``contained`` in the envelope, the client
00263                  *  **MUST** release it back to litm.
00264                  */
00265                 litm_code litm_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp);
00266 
00267 
00268                 /**
00269                  * Shutdown
00270                  *
00271                  * This function attempts to shutdown all the connection
00272                  * threads in a graceful manner.  This function is blocking.
00273                  */
00274                 void litm_shutdown(void);
00275 
00276 
00277                 /**
00278                  * Returns a copy of the pointer to the message.
00279                  *
00280                  * @param *envlp the envelope from which to extract the pointer to the message
00281                  *
00282                  * This function should be used instead
00283                  *  of relying on the ``litm_envelope``
00284                  *  data structure.
00285                  *
00286                  *  <b>** DO NOT** modify the message!</b>
00287                  *
00288                  */
00289                 void *litm_get_message(litm_envelope *envlp);
00290 
00291 
00292                 /**
00293                  * Translates a code to a message pointer
00294                  *
00295                  * @param code a <i>litm_code</i> to translate to a string version
00296                  *
00297                  */
00298                 char *litm_translate_code(litm_code code);

00301 #endif /* LITM_H_ */
